paragraphs.label: A
paragraphs.content: This book describes the creativity of Aboriginal people living in the driest parts of Australia. Stunning reproductions of paintings, beautiful photography and informative text.

paragraphs.label: B
paragraphs.content: Pocket-sized maps and illustrations with detailed information on the nesting sites and migration patterns of Australian birds. This is a classic booklet suitable for both beginner and expert.

paragraphs.label: C
paragraphs.content: Packed full of information for the avid hiker, this book is a must. Photographs, maps and practical advice will guide your journeys on foot through the forests of the southern continent.

paragraphs.label: D
paragraphs.content: More than an atlas - this book contains maps, photographs and an abundance of information on the geography and climate of countries from around the globe.

paragraphs.label: E
paragraphs.content: Australia's premier mountain biking guidebook - taking you through a host of national parks and state forests.

paragraphs.label: F
paragraphs.content: Here's the A-Z of Australian native animals - take an in-depth look at their lives and characteristics, complete with fantastic photographs and informative text.

paragraphs.label: G
paragraphs.content: Graphic artists have worked with researchers and scientists to illustrate how these prehistoric creatures lived and died on the Australian continent.

paragraphs.label: H
paragraphs.content: A definitive handbook on outdoor safety - with a specific focus on equipment, nutrition, first aid, clothing and bush skills.

paragraphs.label: I
paragraphs.content: Detailed guides to 15 scenic car tours that will take you onto fascinating wilderness tracks and trails that you could otherwise have missed.

question_groups.instruction: Choose the correct title for each book from the list of book titles below. Write the correct number i-xi in boxes 8-14 on your answer sheet.
